team19.weatherapp

Class City

  • java.lang.Object
    • team19.weatherapp.City

  • public class City
extends java.lang.Object
    City class holds the information for the three city properties:
    • Current Weather
    • Short Term Forecast
    • Long Term Forecast
    The city object encapsulates these three objects, and allows the user to access all of the city data through one object.
    Author:
    Scott Mackie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      City(java.lang.String name, char tempUnits, char windUnits)
      The city constructor calls a json retriever to set the current temp, short term forecast, and long term forecast data.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • City

        public City(java.lang.String name,
            char tempUnits,
            char windUnits)
     throws org.json.JSONException
        The city constructor calls a json retriever to set the current temp, short term forecast, and long term forecast data.
        Parameters:
        name - The name is required in order to look up and parse data for the city
        tempUnits - The temperature units shows which units the temperature data should be stored in
        windUnits - The wind units show which units the wind data should be stored in
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
